summary: The term internet encompasses the modern evolution of ecosystems beyond geographic boundaries. It explores decentralized, non-hierarchical structures inspired by diverse disciplines to create sustainable and regenerative systems. The concept is closely linked with cultural shifts and innovative practices aimed at building resilient networks and communities from fragmented pieces.
excerpt: The fragmentation of the internet reflects broader cultural shifts. Ecosystem architecture integrates diverse ideas to create sustainable, decentralized, and regenerative systems from fragmented pieces.
